_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Pipeline Transportation of Refined Petroleum Products

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

The safety of our employees, contract employees, customers, neighbors and the environment is a core business value and an important priority. Reducing the impact of our operations on the environment is also a priority. NuStar Energy LP is committed to achieving Health, Safety and Environmental (HSE) excellence throughout the organization.

NuStar management has also agreed to correct in a timely manner all hazards identified through self inspections, employee reports, accident investigations, or any other means with interim protection as necessary.

We will provide the results of self-inspections and accident investigation to our employees upon request.

We will continuously seek areas for improvement and ways to raise our employees level of awareness regarding all aspects of safety and health.

The Wolsey Terminal was built and put into service in the mid 1960s. The facility was built to store and transport propane (RMP regulated substance), refined products and a Liquid Mixture (LM) of the two products. The propane, refined products and the LM are delivered, via an 6" pipeline, to the Wolsey Terminal from the NuStar Terminal in Yankton, SD. The 3,944,068 lbs. of propane, which exceeds the 10,000 lbs. threshold quantity (TQ) of the OSHA PSM requirements, is stored in, one of ten, pressurized bullet tanks. The LM is stored in one pressurized bullet tanks and is routed through a Depropanizer distillation process, which removes any excess propane from the LM and this propane is then stored in the propane bullet tanks with the good propane. The propane is then removed from the site by propane trucks that deliver it to various customers. The refined products are also stored in tanks and pumped to various customers by trucks.

The Wolsey Facility complies with many different regulatory agencies, which include, but not limited to;

- OSHA's Process Safety Management (PSM) Program (1910.119) of Highly Hazardous Chemicals.

- OSHA's Emergency Action Plan

Regulation, 29 CFR 1910.38(c).

- OSHA's HAZWOPER Regulation, 29 CFR 1910.120.

- Federal Oil Pollution Act of 1990: U.S. DOT Final Rule for Transportation Related On-Shore Facilities as published in   

  49 CFR Part 194 (Response Plans for Onshore Oil Pipelines).

- Federal Oil Pollution Act of 1990: U.S. EPA Final Rule for non-Transportation Related on-Shore Facilities as published 

  in 40 CFR Part 112.

- DOT Part 195 Transportation of Hazardous Liquids by Pipeline.

- DOT Part 199 Drug and Alcohol Testing.

The Wolsey Facility conducts two equipment deployment drills (one un-announced) a year, Quarterly Qualified Individual (QI) drills and an annual table top drill is performed during the annual HAZWOPER training. 

We have an excellent five year accident free history. We have had no accidental releases in the last five years and in fact the Wolsey Terminal was built in the mid 1960s and to this date we have had zero propane releases. 

The Wolsey Emergency Response Program works together with the Wolsey Volunteer Fire Department and the Huron Fire Department. The Wolsey employees are not first responders, but have received training in the notification process of the Wolsey and Huron Fire Departments (first responder). The employees also participate in an annual evacuation drill, in the event an evacuation is required. 

Various employees at the Wolsey Terminal have received CPR training, and all employees have received annual HAZWOPER training. Numerous other drills are conducted at the Wolsey Terminal as stated previously.

Safety is the #1 core value of our company. Whether in performing everyday work or in the planning and maintenance of project work, safety is top priority. Some of the future improvements towards safety are: 

- Management and employee's are teaming together to pursue the OSHA VPP Star award. In this pursuit, there are several 

  changes planned to improve safety and some of them are;

  - Quarterly Hazard Identification Audits

  - Ele

ctrical cord quarterly inspection program

  - First Use Vehicle inspection program

  - Lifting sling(s) quarterly inspection program

The regional office has installed an electronic MOC process, which helps expedite the approval process and provide a more in-depth safety analysis of the proposed change. 

An electronic MSDS approval process has been completed and allows users at any of our sites the ability to view any MSDS through the company intranet. 

Our Industrial Hygiene program is in the hands of a 3rd party, Certified Environmental Management (CEM).

We have implemented automatic tank gauging on our tanks which alleviates the need to climb the tanks on a daily basis.
